intro: Astraea macroura, commonly known as the long-tongued astraea, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant produces pendulous, greenish-yellow blooms with long, slender petals. Astraea macroura typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its unique floral structure suggests a specialized pollination mechanism, likely involving specific insect pollinators.
